main event: On July 3, 1967, a metallic object emitting wisps of smoke was observed traveling south over Kansas City, Kansas for approximately one minute.
interesting points: The object had a slight wobble in flight,The sighting lasted for about one minute,No photographs or physical evidence were recovered following the sighting,The Air Force termed it probable fallout,No other reports were acknowledged by the Air Force after the incident.
witness description: The primary observer had a background in engineering and aviation, providing a detailed account of the sighting.
